name: OWASP Austin Chapter Monthly Meeting - April 2023 (Online)
description:
*Due to supplying lunch for attendees so we have sufficient foods, if you would like to attend in-person at NI, please see* \-\- Coming Soon\!

30 minutes of meet-and-greet and Chapter information, then the Presentation!

name: Zed Attack Proxy
description: Join us online, Tuesday, April 4, at 6:30PM to learn about Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) from the co-author of 'Zed Attack Proxy Cookbook: Hacking tactics, techniques, and procedures for testing web applications and APIs', Ryan Soper! Ryan will discuss his book as well as walk us through some examples of using ZAP.

name: BASC - Boston Application Security Conference
description:
**Join us for [BASC 2023](basconf.org) on April 1.**

**See [conference website](https://www.basconf.org/home) for details and [register at eventbrite](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-application-security-conference-basc-2023-tickets-542873247497)**

(There is no conference registration or RSVP here on meetup.)

name: **Speaker change** OWASP Brisbane - March
description:
Hi All!

We have a speaker change for this event. The new date for Paul McCarty will be announced soon.

Here is all you need to know about our new speaker for our March event, at Thoughtworks Brisbane on the 30th of March!

**Speaker:** Louis Nyffenegger

**Title:** Introduction to SAML and its Security

**Talk Description:** SAML is one of the key protocols used to perform Single Sign-On. Especially for enterprises who...

ACKCHYUALLY!!! SAML is a Markup Language, like HTML... You don't code in HTML, you don't SSO with SAML.

Ok, thanks for the clarification. In this talk we are going to look at how SAML is used to provide Single Sign-on and what security issues can arise.

**Thank you to our venue sponsor:**
[Thoughtworks](https://www.thoughtworks.com)

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-
For those of you who have joined us at previous events, unfortunately, we are unable to provide drinks and pizzas at this stage. However, we plan to meet at Pig’n’Whistle, 123 Eagle St, at 4:30 pm. Then, we will head over to Thoughtworks at around 5:15 pm.

If you can, come and join us!

name: OWASP Suffolk - ZAP and Burp the Walkthrough
description:
For the past two years I've been using OWASP ZAP and PortSwigger's Burp Suite (Community Edition), switching between the two as I learned hacking techniques and took part in CTFs. Each has their own pros and cons, features I like, quirks, and even room for improvement.
For this event we will be taking a slow walk through the interfaces and features of both tools side-by-side with both pointed at a vulnerable target.
This will be an interactive session where you can ask questions throughout. This event is aimed at the beginner who wishes to know more about these two popular tools. This is an unbiased demonstration and both tools will be in an out-of-the-box state with no optional extras / add-ons / plugins installed.

**Agenda:**

* OWASP updates
* Live interactive demonstration of ZAP and Burp Suite CE

Disclaimer: As always our events are designed to educate. Any tools and techniques demonstrated are for informative purposes only. We do not endorse their use for malicious purposes.

This talk will not be recorded.

description:

**Impacts de la digitalisation sur les internautes,** par **Orace KPAKPO**, Ing Réseaux et Systèmes, Analyst Cybersécurité à EMES SARL, leader du chapitre OWASP Cotonou

**Digitalisation et sécurité au Bénin,** par **Victor OYETOLA**, Expert TIC, responsable du SPTIC à l'UAC

name: The Art of Deception - Outsmarting the Attackers
description:
**UPDATE** - *The March event has been moved to NorQuest college to accommodate catering services and a larger than expected audience.*

**Location**
*10215 108 St NW, Edmonton, AB T5J 1L6*
*Room 2-013 - SCFL - Downtown*
*Directions and parking information are located in the photos section at the bottom of this page.*

## About The Event###

  
**RSVP for CATERING COMPANY + DOOR PRIZES**

https://www.meetup.com/meetup-group-opbybwve/

**[SentinelOne](https://www.sentinelone.com/)** is sending a squadron of their finest experts to share their knowledge on the elusive art of **MITRE** deception.

As a pioneering force in this field, they will be providing not only a delectable **BBQ** **DINNER** catered by **Edmonton's** local **[CORNERSTONE BBQ](https://www.cornerstonebbq.com/)**, but also valuable insights on how to outsmart the crafty attackers. Think of it as a masterclass on the tactics and strategies needed to protect your organization from cyber-attacks.

In the words of the renowned ancient Chinese general **Sun Tzu**, "All warfare is based on deception." And just as Sun Tzu believed in the importance of deception in warfare, Sentinel One understands the significance of deception in the ever-evolving battlefield of cybersecurity. So, join us for this informative session, and let's learn how to effectively deploy deception techniques to turn the tables on attackers.

name: OWASP Frankfurt #60 - Security Revolution: Women Leading the Way in AppSec
description:
Hi all, for our last OWASP Frankfurt Chapter event before the upcoming [German OWASP Day 2023](https://god.owasp.de/2023/) edition, join us for our **Women in AppSec Special**, where we'll be tackling two of the most pressing topics in the industry today: enhancing security culture through security champions, and offensive security beyond the checkbox. There will also be plenty of time to socialize before and after the event at the venue.

_What's going to happen?
We look forward to welcoming you to our OWASP Frankfurt Meetup hosted by **CHECK24 Frankfurt.**

_What are we going to talk about?

* _Talk 1 - \*"\***Enhancing security culture through security champions**" by **Diana Waithanji**, Cybersecurity engineer at SAP.
As software development becomes increasingly fast-paced, the need for secure development practices has never been more urgent. Enter the security champion - an individual who advocates for security within their team and takes ownership of all security issues. In this talk, Diana will delve into the principles of success in advocacy through security champions, and explore methods for training software developers to become security champions themselves. Drawing on real-world examples, Diana will also showcase a partnership model in AppSec that has proven to be effective in enhancing security culture within development teams. If you want to learn how to foster a culture of secure development in your team, this talk is not to be missed!

* _Talk 2 - "**Beyond the Checkbox: Breaking out of Testing Frameworks**" by **Jiska Classen**, As mobile applications handle sensitive data, ensuring their security is crucial. However, simply securing individual apps is not enough to stop real-world attackers who exploit devices through other avenues. This talk will explore unconventional security testing approaches that can help improve app security by addressing vulnerabilities in the operating system, hardware, and third-party libraries. Discover how attackers can exploit wireless interfaces, sandboxing, privilege checking bypasses, and more. Let's explore why these attack vectors are relevant in practice and how to address them beyond standard security testing checklists.

_Afterwards? We will pre- and conclude the evening with the possibility to **socialize** at the venue with **free food and cold & hot drinks** kindly provided by **CHECK24 Frankfurt**.

_When
Our Meetup takes place on the last Wednesday of the month in April, namely on 26.04.2023 from 18:00 to 21.00 o'clock CEST.

_Where?
CHECK24 Frankfurt is located at Speicherstraße 55 in Frankfurt am Main, ca. 15min within walking distance of Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof.

_Interested in **giving a talk** yourself?
Get in touch with the Frankfurt Chapter Leads (Dan Gora or Jonas Becker)

_And now?
Save the date, **spread the word** and bring your friends and colleagues along to our event.

_Follow Us!
Also, follow us on **[Twitter #owasp_frankfurt](https://twitter.com/owasp_frankfurt)**[ ](https://twitter.com/owasp_frankfurt)and refer to our [OWASP Frankfurt site](https://owasp.org/www-chapter-germany/stammtische/frankfurt/) for information including slides and recordings of previous presentations

We're looking forward to seeing you for this in-person event!

name: BugSmash 2023
description:
**Only for IIITD Students**
OWASP IIITD is back with its no-prerequisite, highly thrilling, one-of-a-kind flagship contest BugSmash.

No prerequisites required, just come ready to put your skills to the test and find those vulnerabilities and smash them damn bugs in the code. Be ready to google stuff, because you'll need it. Make StackOverflow and manual pages (or probably even reddit idk) your best friends as you battle it out with your fellow contestants and climb up the leaderboard in a two hour rush of adrenaline.

**Date: Wednesday, 29th March 2022**
**Time: 5:30 pm**
**Venue: A106, R&D Block, IIIT Delhi**

**Chocolates for the First Blood in each challenge.**
**Refreshments for all attendees :)**

name: OWASP Monthly meeting
description: The OWASP Foundation came online on December 1st, 2001 it was established as a not-for-profit charitable organization in the United States on April 21, 2004, to ensure the ongoing availability and support for our work at OWASP. OWASP is an international organization and the OWASP Foundation supports OWASP efforts around the world. OWASP is an open community dedicated to enabling organizations to conceive, develop, acquire, operate, and maintain applications that can be trusted. All of the OWASP tools, documents, forums, and chapters are free and open to anyone interested in improving application security. We advocate approaching application security as a people, process, and technology problem because the most effective approaches to application security include improvements in all of these areas. We can be found at www.owasp.org.

name: Reconnaissance like a cyber scout.
description: Por que e de que maneira é levantado informações do perímetro de uma empresa durante uma operação? Como diria o provérbio chinês: "Para cortar uma árvore bem rápido, gaste o dobro do tempo afiando o machado". Trazendo para nossa interpretação: "Consiga o máximo de informações e melhor será o seu resultado da invasão". Esta palestra irá abordar o fundamento de uma enumeração de perímetro, seguindo para a exibição da notória ferramenta ReconFTW que automatiza todo o processo e será concluído detalhando a contribuição do palestrante para o projeto, que é open-source e foi idealizado pelo "Six2dez".

name: OWASP London CTF Tournament [IN-PERSON]
description:
**PLEASE REGISTER ON [EVENTBRITE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/): [https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/)**

**PLEASE NOTE - THE CTF LOCATION, REGISTRATION AND TICKETS FOR THIS EVENT ARE ONLY AVAILABLE ON EVENTBRITE:** **[https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/)**

**OWASP London Chapter** is pleased to announce the OWASP London Capture The Flag(CTF) Tournament kindly sponsored by **Invicti**.

**Doors open and registration**: 5:30pm
**CTF starts**: 6:00pm (we start on time)
**Expected CTF finish and Prize Giving Ceremony**: 8:45pm

OWASP London Chapter is pleased to announce the OWASP London CTF Tournament kindly sponsored by Invicti.

CTF (Capture The Flag) is a type of computer security competition. Contestants are presented with a set of challenges and puzzles which test their creativity, technical skills, vulnerability-finding skills and problem-solving ability. The challenges usually cover a number of categories and when solved, each yields a “flag” which is submitted to a real-time scoring service. The difficulty levels are from beginner to advanced.

Please note that unlike our OWASP London Chapter ‘s previous CTFs this is not a secure coding tournament, but a proper "Hacking CTF". The challenges will be around finding and exploiting application vulnerabilities, not vulnerabilities in the source code.

**IMPORTANT**: Please **bring your own** **LAPTOP** and a **CHARGER** for it.
Top 3 scorers will win exciting prizes generously provided by Invicti and other cyber security technology vendors.

Participation is FREE, but the **number of seats is strictly limited to 50** and **[registration is required](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/574787925157/)** to attend.

**Please remember to bring your own laptop!**

**IMPORTANT**: By participating in this activity you agree to abide by the

**OWASP Code of Conduct** and **Invicti CTF Rules**:

**CODE OF CONDUCT**
We hope you enjoy our events, we care deeply about inclusivity and diversity so that OWASP is a comfortable and welcoming community for everyone. Please reach out to one of our chapter leaders if you have any feedback or would like to speak to us, we take these matters very seriously. You can find the full text of the OWASP Code of Conduct Policy here: [https://owasp.org/www-policy/operational/code-of-conduct](https://owasp.org/www-policy/operational/code-of-conduct)

**INVICTI CTF RULES (Excerpt)**

* Players are not allowed to form teams or groups to solve challenges together.
* Players must not share any information regarding the flags or walkthrough for any of the challenges with other players.
* Players must not try to attack scoring bots, central CTF management application and targets for other players. Those who try to attack any of these systems/applications will be disqualified from the competition.
* Players must not try to perform any denial-of-service attack to any network or application in the competition network.
* Players must not write any walkthroughs for the solutions or share any information regarding the challenges.

You can find the full text of Invicti CTF Rules here: [https://github.com/OWASP/www-chapter-london/blob/master/assets/misc/invicti-ctf-rules.md](https://github.com/OWASP/www-chapter-london/blob/master/assets/misc/invicti-ctf-rules.md)

name: 1st Annual 2023 OWASP Maine Secure Coding Tournament
description:
Are you an appsec guru and pride yourself in secure coding? Are you a developer and know you write **THE MOST** secure code out of your peers? Well here is your chance to come out and prove it and win **$CASH!$**

OWASP Maine partnered with Secure Code Warrior will be hosting the 1st annual OWASP Maine Secure Coding Tournament! This will be an in person meetup where we welcome all software developers and appsec professionals from entry level to principal. Bring your laptop and your secure coding wits and compete against your peers to be crowned the most secure coder in the state of Maine for 2023!

**Prizes will be as follows:**

**1st Place**

* Crowned most secure coder in the state of Maine
* Pretty cool trophy (pics to come)
* $500 VISA giftcard!

**2nd Place**

* Second place trophy
* Some cool Secure Code Warrior Swag
* $100 VISA giftcard!

**3rd Place**

* Third place trophy
* Some slightly less cool swag
* $50 VISA giftcard!

For everyone else? You will gain new skills in secure coding, network with your peers, and also get free pizza and drinks!

Participating in the tournament is not required, feel free to join us either way for networking and learning something new!

**When:** Wednesday April 19th 2023 6:00pm - 8:00pm est
**Where:** IDEXX Laboratories 1 Idexx Dr. Westbrook, ME 04092
**Who:** Security and Development leadership and practitioners from Maine and all of northern New England

**REQUIREMENTS:**

**\*You must also register for the Secure Code Warrior tournament here:** [https://discover.securecodewarrior.com/tournament-maine23.html](https://discover.securecodewarrior.com/tournament-maine23.html)
**\*You must bring your own laptop/machine to participate**
**\*You must be onsite and in person to participate**

**OWASP Maine Linkedin Page:** [https://www.linkedin.com/company/owasp-maine/](https://www.linkedin.com/company/owasp-maine/)

name: April 2023 OWASP Chapter Netherlands Meetup
description:
This is an online meeting and will be streamed on YouTube.

19:00 - 19:10 - **Welcome and OWASP updates**
19:10 - 19:55 - **The Rise of the Security Verification Standard** by **Josh Grossman**
19:55 - 20:05 - **Questions and** **Break**
20:05 - 20:50 - **OWASP Juice Shop** by **Björn Kimminich**

**The Rise of the Security Verification Standard**
*Abstract:*
We are currently seeing a big uptick in the progression of the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) as well as the Mobile version (MASVS). Not only are two major releases in the pipeline (5.0 and 2.0 respectively) but we are now seeing industry stand up, take notice and start expecting more from applications, based on these standards. In this talk, Josh Grossman (one of the ASVS project leaders) will take you through these key developments including our vision for the upcoming version 5.0 of the ASVS and how you and your employer can be involved in the final release.
This will also be a chance to hear first-hand about a couple of new programmes where you will see the SVSs being more widely used and required and how you can prepare your organizations for this significant impact this will have, whether you are developing applications or you are assessing them.

*Bio:*
Josh Grossman has worked as a consultant in IT and Application Security and Risk for 15 years now, as well as a Software Developer. This has given him an in-depth understanding of how to manage the balance between business needs, developer needs and security needs which goes into a successful software security programme.

Josh is currently CTO for Bounce Security where he helps clients improve and get better value from their application security processes and provides specialist application security advice. His consultancy work has led him to work, speak and deliver training both locally and worldwide including privately for ISACA and Manicode and publicly for OWASP's Global AppSec conferences. In his spare time, he co-leads the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard project and is on the OWASP Israel chapter board.

He was also recognized as a Key Contributor for the OWASP Proactive Controls project and has also contributed to the OWASP Top 10 Risks project and the OWASP JuiceShop project.

**OWASP Juice Shop**
*Abstract:*
OWASP Juice Shop is probably the most modern and sophisticated insecure web application! It can be used in security training, awareness demos, CTFs and as a guinea pig for security tools!

Juice Shop encompasses vulnerabilities from the entire OWASP Top Ten along with many other security flaws found in real-world applications!

At this event, we will take a tour through the application, hack it live on screen, learn about Coding Challenges, CTF mode, cheat detection, custom theming, and more!

*Bio:*
Bjoern Kimminich works as Product Group Lead Application Ecosystem at Kuehne + Nagel, responsible – among other things – for the Application Security program in corporate IT. He is an OWASP Lifetime Member, the project leader of the OWASP Juice Shop, and a co-chapter leader for the OWASP Germany Chapter. Björn also currently chairs the OWASP Project Committee.

name: Kubernetes – “containers aren't just for leftovers”
description:
An exploratory look at what Kubernetes is, how it works, and how it can be implemented to provide modern solutions to dated problems.

5:30pm - Socializing (Towne Square Food and Spirits)
7:00pm - Announcements followed by this month's speaker presentation starts
8:00pm - presentation ends, socializing

Towne Square Food and Spirits entrance:
Park in the East parking lot of 1 Town center and look for the awning to the right of the main entrance of the 1 town center building. That is the restaurant. We meet in the main dinning center to the right of the restaurant's entrance. The presentation is given in the room to the left of the Bar you face once you enter. It's advised first time attendees show up before to socialize but also follow the group into the presentation area.

name: OWASP Peterborough: Chapter Kick Off
description:
**Join the first ever OWASP Peterborough Chapter event!**

To kick the chapter off, the session focuses on introducing OWASP and similar topics, whilst networking in a great venue!

We're still confirming some specifics, but can promise outstanding speakers focusing on:

* Introducing OWASP and Web Application Security
* Web Application Firewalls (WAFs)
* What's coming up next
* How to get involved in the security field

An agenda will be shared closer to the MeetUp date.

**Who is it for?**
Everybody! Come along, bring a friend, share with your colleagues.

A principle of the chapter is to ensure **cyber security is accessible** for everyone. You don't need to be a security professional, each session will break down topics to ensure everybody can take something away.

**When is it?**

* Wednesday 29th March
* **Arrive** from 7:30pm
* **Sessions start** at 8PM sharp
* **Networking** from 9:30pm
* **Close** by 11pm

**How can you get involved?**

* Respond **'I'm coming!'** to this group
* Join our **[slack](https://join.slack.com/share/enQtNDkyNjM5ODI3ODgzMi02N2ZkNGQ2NzIzZjQ4M2FjOTc1MGQxNmRlOTlkZTJmZjc1MmZmYzMxYzFkMWEwMzQyMzdkMDJjZjk1N2FiNzUy) channel**
* Check out our OWASP Chapter [page](https://owasp.org/www-chapter-peterborough/)

**Sponsors!**
Sponsors enable events like ours to happen. We want to give a huge shout out to our sponsors - Cybanetix. Check them out to understand how you can secure your business, people and network: https://cybanetix.com

We look forward to seeing you there!

name: Security Social Lunch Hours
description:
At noon on the 2nd Wednesday of every month we host a social meeting on Zoom with mini talks and breakout rooms. The main room will always be open for social time but we plan to have 1-2 topic breakouts you can join. If the breakout session topic interests you, join that discussion. Feeling more like a casual chat and exploring other topics? Visit the main room to strike up a conversation.

Suggest topics you’d like to see breakout rooms for and let us know if you’d like to sign up to lead one.

description: Following up on the success of our first AppSec round table in January, we'll continue the format for our April meeting. The host will present questions to get the conversation going, and the group will share insights and wisdom!

description:
**Title**: Tracing web application exploitability through code review and taint analysis
**Speaker**: Dana Epp

Come learn how to look at your web apps and APIs more offensively to discover the exploitability of your code before your adversaries do.

This event is sponsored by **Microsoft** \- thanks for providing us space and food\.

name: OWASP Vilnius #4
description:
I'm glad to announce, that this will be a physical event organised with VU Cyber Security Lab in the Vilnius University premises (Baltupiai, Vilnius).

The agenda:

1\) Linas Bukauskas \(Kibernetinio saugumo labaratorijos vadovas \| VU MIF\) \- "Kibernetinio saugumo laboratorijos veiklos\, projektai\, bendradarbiavimo galimybės" \(lithuanian\)

2\) Agne Marija Bucyte \(Vehicle Cybersecurity Analyst \| Block Harbor
Cybersecurity) - "Automotive (car) Cybersecurity trends".
We will be discussing some of the latest trends in the world of automotive
cybersecurity, gain insight on some latest statistics and get familiar
with some standards that help keep the streets safe.

3\) Ulad Pyanou \( Application Security Engineer \| EPAM Systems\)\- "A day in life of the Security Engineer"\. During the talk Ulad will show
examples of tasks that are being solved by different security teams

Location: VU MIF, Didlaukio g. 47. 103 auditorium.

See you soon!

name: OWASP Waterloo - Enhancing the security of your Kubernetes cluster
description:
Dear OWASP Waterloo Community Members,

We are excited to announce our upcoming OWASP chapter meetup on "Enhancing the security of your Kubernetes cluster." Join us virtually for an engaging and informative session on securing Kubernetes clusters using best practices and cutting-edge security tools.

During this meetup, our expert speakers will cover the following topics:

1. Running CIS Benchmarks against Kubernetes Clusters: Learn how to assess the security configuration of your K8s cluster using the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks to ensure compliance with industry best practices.
2. Seccomp and AppArmor in Kubernetes: Discover the importance of implementing Linux security features like Seccomp and AppArmor in your K8s environment to limit system calls and resource access, minimizing the attack surface.
3. Using Falco to Identify a Breach in Cluster: Explore how to deploy and use Falco, an open-source cloud-native runtime security project, for monitoring K8s cluster security, identifying potential breaches, and generating alerts for security incidents.

This meetup is a fantastic opportunity for security professionals, developers, and Kubernetes enthusiasts to network, share knowledge and stay up-to-date on the latest security trends and best practices in Kubernetes.

Event Details:
Date: March 30, 2023
Time: 6:30 PM - 7.30 PM EST
Location: https://us06web.zoom.us/j/85253024263?pwd=ckdtRE5XTmlBUFpNUTc3YXFtRlVhdz09

We look forward to seeing you!

name: OWASP Frankfurt #60 - Security Revolution: Women Leading the Way in AppSec
description:
Hi all, for our last OWASP Frankfurt Chapter event before the upcoming [German OWASP Day 2023](https://god.owasp.de/2023/) edition, join us for our **Women in AppSec Special**, where we'll be tackling two of the most pressing topics in the industry today: enhancing security culture through security champions, and offensive security beyond the checkbox. There will also be plenty of time to socialize before and after the event at the venue.

_What's going to happen?
We look forward to welcoming you to our OWASP Frankfurt Meetup hosted by **CHECK24 Frankfurt.**

_What are we going to talk about?

* _Talk 1 - \*"\***Enhancing security culture through security champions**" by **Diana Waithanji**, Cybersecurity engineer at SAP.
As software development becomes increasingly fast-paced, the need for secure development practices has never been more urgent. Enter the security champion - an individual who advocates for security within their team and takes ownership of all security issues. In this talk, Diana will delve into the principles of success in advocacy through security champions, and explore methods for training software developers to become security champions themselves. Drawing on real-world examples, Diana will also showcase a partnership model in AppSec that has proven to be effective in enhancing security culture within development teams. If you want to learn how to foster a culture of secure development in your team, this talk is not to be missed!

* _Talk 2 - "**Beyond the Checkbox: Breaking out of Testing Frameworks**" by **Jiska Classen**, As mobile applications handle sensitive data, ensuring their security is crucial. However, simply securing individual apps is not enough to stop real-world attackers who exploit devices through other avenues. This talk will explore unconventional security testing approaches that can help improve app security by addressing vulnerabilities in the operating system, hardware, and third-party libraries. Discover how attackers can exploit wireless interfaces, sandboxing, privilege checking bypasses, and more. Let's explore why these attack vectors are relevant in practice and how to address them beyond standard security testing checklists.

_Afterwards? We will pre- and conclude the evening with the possibility to **socialize** at the venue with **free food and cold & hot drinks** kindly provided by **CHECK24 Frankfurt**.

_When
Our Meetup takes place on the last Wednesday of the month in April, namely on 26.04.2023 from 18:00 to 21.00 o'clock CEST.

_Where?
CHECK24 Frankfurt is located at Speicherstraße 55 in Frankfurt am Main, ca. 15min within walking distance of Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof.

_Interested in **giving a talk** yourself?
Get in touch with the Frankfurt Chapter Leads (Dan Gora or Jonas Becker)

_And now?
Save the date, **spread the word** and bring your friends and colleagues along to our event.

_Follow Us!
Also, follow us on **[Twitter #owasp_frankfurt](https://twitter.com/owasp_frankfurt)**[ ](https://twitter.com/owasp_frankfurt)and refer to our [OWASP Frankfurt site](https://owasp.org/www-chapter-germany/stammtische/frankfurt/) for information including slides and recordings of previous presentations

We're looking forward to seeing you for this in-person event!
